explosives.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data on the kick-off temperature and decomposition energy (though the substance contains nitro groups, with its oxygen budget calculated at -96).

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though containing nitro groups.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point 56degC Lide (84th, 2003), test temperature: 140degC)

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though being organic compounds containing oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 1,000mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 1,000mg/kg and 2,503mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 99-1 (2000)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on the rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 99-1 (2000)): "The substance causes slight irritation of the skin," though the results of 4-hour application are not available.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on the rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 99-1 (2000)): "The substance causes moderate irritation of the eye."

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Based on the description in CERI Hazard Data 99-1 (2000): "No sensitization was observed in test animals while there are reports on human cases where positive responses were observed among workers occupationally exposed to 1,4-dichloro-2-nitrobenzene in manufacturing plants. The substance is thus considered a sensitizing skin irritant.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: No data on mutagenicity/genotoxicity in vivo tests are available while there are positive data on in vitro assays for chromosome aberration and reverse mutation (Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1996), SIDS (2005) and CERI Hazard Data 99-1(2000)). However, classification is not possible as the positive results obtained are not conclusive.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Based on the evidence of adverse effects on testes (azoospermia) at doses inducing maternal toxicity with lactation defect, described in SIDS (2005), MOE Risk Assessment vol.3 (2004) and CERI Hazard Data 99-1 (2000).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "formation of methemoglobin and mild cyanosis," "loss of balance, prone position, decreased locomotor activity" (CERI Hazard Data 99-1 (2000)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (blood system) Category 2 (nervous system, liver, testes)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "decreased locomotor activity, hind limb weakness, staggering gait, prone or lateral (or side, lying) position, bradypnea, wryneck" (Report by the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (1996)), "increased liver weight, bilirubinemia, hepatocyte hypertrophy, adverse effects on the testes including necrosis of the seminiferous epithelia, azoospermia, impaired spermatogenic ability" (SIDS (2005)), "decreases in RBC count/hemoglobin concentration, extramedullary hematopoiesis of the spleen, hyperemia, deposit of hemosiderin" (CERI Hazard Data 99-1 (2000)). The effects on nervous system, liver, testes were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2, while the effects on the blood system for Category 1.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96 hours LC50=0.118mg/L of the fish (Carp) (CERI/NITE Hazard Assessment Report (preliminary version), 2006).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF=103(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 4%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.
